books.title: A taste of the Habibi Festival
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The Public Theater in New York has been presenting the first Habibi Festival of contemporary Arabic music. Host Marco Werman offers one example of the performing artists: Alsarah and the Nubatones, featuring a song frontwoman Alsarah wrote in 2019 in solidarity with fellow Sudanese protesting for democracy.

books.title: Jordanian musicians worry that their national orchestra could be shuttered
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: COVID-19 has been hard for artists and musicians around the world as clubs, concert venues and opera houses shut down.But in Jordan, it’s been especially detrimental — the country’s only symphonic orchestra was already in trouble financially, and may be shuttered permanently.

books.title: Coronavirus is changing the music industry, as long as musicians survive
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The ritualistic music scene has come to a halt. Online shows are trying to change the market dynamics, but its festive aspect of listening to live music is at stake.

books.title: 'I Silenti' gives a voice to those who died in the Romani genocide
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The performance piece features musician Tcha Limberger, who is Roma, and pays homage to the hundreds of thousands who died in the Romani genocide during the Holocaust, whose stories often go untold.

books.title: An Iraqi artist fights a lone battle to save the traditional Maqam
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The musical form, which resonated for hundreds of years in Iraq, is now on the edge of a precipice but Hamid al Saadi has taken a journey to save it from extinction.

books.title: Travel takes on new meaning in this jazz pianist’s latest album
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Taiwanese American jazz pianist Eric Pan's new album reflects on metaphysical treks — through the world of the music and within the self.

books.title: A Syrian rock band finds an audience in Lebanon
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: We meet members of the Syrian rock band Tanjaret Daghet. The trio fled the civil war in Syria almost a decade ago and has achieved success in Lebanon. But now, the members of the group are ready to move on.

books.title: Kurdish music as protest
books.author: Emilie Pons, Reese Erlich
books.description: Reese Erlich and Emilie Pons discovered, that conflict is reflected in Kurdish music, which has a long history of documenting their struggle.

books.title: Anti-classist Turkish jazz
books.author: Emilie Pons, Reese Erlich
books.description: A crossroads of European, Middle Eastern and Asian cultures, Turkey's music scene is a unique cultural melting pot. Jazz musician Okay Temiz has been at the forefront of this eclecticism for many years, credited with creating fusion jazz.

books.title: An Invisible Wall
books.author: Emilie Pons , Irem Karakaya
books.description: For many international musicians, traveling to and performing in the U.S. has become prohibitively complex.

books.title: Lila Downs concert at SummerStage
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The Mexican-American singer thrilled the Puebla York, LatinX and Nuevo York crowd with an extraordinarily entertaining show.

books.title: Jazz in Marciac: Attractive Sounds in an Attractive Place
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Reports from jazz festival in the south of France

books.title: Chavela Vargas was a ‘revolutionary’ who ushered in a new ranchera style
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Even as an untrained musician, Chavela Vargas had the ability to captivate her audiences after singing only the first few words of a song.

books.title: Eclectic Montreal Jazz Festival strikes again
books.author: Emilie Pons, Reese Erlich
books.description: The Montreal Jazz Festival is thriving after 39 years, because several elements are in place to maintain its strength.

books.title: Marshall Allen, Spirit Awakened
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Nothing happens the way you would expect during a Sun Ra Arkestra performance. The musicians play from the heart and spirit, says 93-year-old jazz master saxophonist Marshall Allen, who leads the legendary Sun Ra Arkestra

books.title: Pair successfully directs 'Chavela' the story of an idiosyncratic star
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Mexican singer Chavela Vargas, who embodies utter simplicity and utmost complexity at the same time?  This is what filmmakers Catherine Gund and Daresha Kyi achieved with their documentary Chavela.

books.title: What We Loved At Winter Jazzfest 2016
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Winter Jazzfest's expansion has changed its aftertaste somewhat — this year's significantly greater geographic distribution spread out the festival's crowds across a wider swath of territory

books.title: Costa Rican capital stars in composer’s musical odyssey
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: An interesting composition by trumpet player Etienne Charles.

books.title: Super Mambo
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Costa Rican vibraphonist Felipe Fournier, pays tribute to Tito Puente at New York City Blue Note Jazz Festival.

books.title: Salsa Stars Remember The Good Old Days
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Latino musicians reminisced about the South Bronx’s heyday as the epicenter of the city’s salsa explosion.

books.title: Exhibit Highlights girls forced into marriage
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: An exhibit of the work of Pulitzer-Prize winning photographer Stephanie Sinclair in Melrose highlights the stark realities faced by young women who are married off to much older men in countries around the world.

books.title: Artists Add Color to Two Bronx Neigbourhoods
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Mott Haven and Hunts Point are the canvas for two new arts projects.

books.title: TONICA
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Jazz freaks exist everywhere, Mexico included. Although Guadalajara has no official jazz club, it does have TONICA.

books.title: Michel Petrucciani
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The 'Mischievous Elf' Of The Piano.

books.title: Amadou And Mariam
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: There is something magical and unusual about seeing two talented blind singers perform together on stage in front of a huge crowd in Central Park.

books.title: Conrad Herwig Quintet
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The Blue Note shows were advertised as 'The Latin Side of Joe Henderson.'

books.title: Ruben Blades: Live at NJPAC
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Report on performance by noted Panamanian singer/songwriter at NewJersey Performing Arts Center on Friday November 4th, 2011

books.title: Henry Threadgill opens at the new Roulette
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Idiosyncratic figure Henry Threadgill, a Chicago native,performed with his sextet Zooid at the new Roulette location, in Brooklyn

books.title: Angelique Kidjo, Dianne Reeves and Lizz Wright in Newark, N.J.
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Three singers mesmerize an audience with stellar performances and “The Truth”

books.title: Japan Benefit Concert At The Village Vanguard
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: A collaboration between Migiwa Miyajima and Sixteen As One Music Inc.'

books.title: Bruce Barth Trio
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Delighted an audience of jazz aficionados, gathered for a lovely CD release party

books.title: Panama Jazz Festival
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The Danilo Pérez Foundation brings musicians from France, Boston and New York, as well as young Panamanian, Chilean, Argentinian, Mexican or Colombian jazz musicians

books.title: A feast for all
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Abbey Lincoln at the Montreal's In ternational Jazz Festival

books.title: Fest ready for ‘Standoff’
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: The cast of new Fox drama “Standoff” will join the New York Television Festival for a special screening of the pilot on Sept. 16.

books.title: Sexy ‘South’ slowly sizzles
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Even with a healthy dollop of publicity, releasing foreign films remains a delicate business. But Shadow Distribution, a tiny releasing outfit in Waterville, Maine, has found it’s worth it to nurture a long, slow release for pic like “Heading South” — even one that opens in the middle of summer blockbuster season

books.title: ‘Brothers’ reborn
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Helmers' take new turn with tome

books.title: Shark Week gets PR blitz
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Discovery puts teeth in marketing campaign

books.title: Mayor gives extra credit
books.author: Emilie Pons
books.description: Bloomberg extends Gotham tax program
